lead_paragraph: Though the House Committee on Foreign. Affairs has voted to consider at this time only the question of arming American merchant ships, a more important question made its appearance as soon as the committee's hearings began yesterday. This is the question of repealing the prohibitions in the Neutrality Act which now forbid our merchant ships to carry goods through "combat zones" and to belligerent ports.
abstract: ed on Hull, Knox and Stimson stand
